2021.question:
CONTEXT: 'Read! In the name of your Lord who created—Created man from a clinging substance.' (Surah al-Alaq 96:1-2).

1. Where was the Prophet (S.A.W) when these first verses were revealed?
2021.explanation: The first revelation occurred in the Cave of Hira on Mount Nur.

2021.question: [Refer to context in Q1] Which angel brought this message to the Prophet (S.A.W)?
2021.explanation: Angel Jibril (Gabriel) is the messenger of Allah to the Prophets.

2021.question: [Refer to context in Q1] Who was the first person the Prophet (S.A.W) consulted after this experience?
2021.explanation: He went directly to his wife, Khadijah, who comforted him.

2021.question: [Refer to context in Q1] The word 'Iqra' in the verse means:
2021.explanation: Iqra is a command to read or recite the word of Allah.

2021.question: [Refer to context in Q1] This revelation marked the beginning of which period?
2021.explanation: It marked the start of Muhammad's mission as the Messenger of Allah.

2021.question: The primary source of Islamic Law (Sharia) is:
2021.explanation: The Qur'an is the foundational and absolute source of guidance.

2021.question: How many chapters (Surahs) are in the Holy Qur'an?
2021.explanation: The Qur'an consists of 114 Surahs of varying lengths.

2021.question: The second pillar of Islam is:
2021.explanation: Salat (Prayer) follows Shahadah in the pillars of Islam.

2021.question: The pre-Islamic period of ignorance in Arabia is known as:
2021.explanation: Jahiliyyah refers to the time before the advent of Islam.

2021.question: Which Caliph ordered the final standardized compilation of the Qur'an?
2021.explanation: Uthman (R.A) produced the Mushaf to unify the Muslim community's recitation.

2021.question: The migration of the early Muslims to Abyssinia (Ethiopia) was to escape:
2021.explanation: The Negus (Najashi) provided refuge to Muslims fleeing Quraysh persecution.

2021.question: The 'Nisab' in Zakat refers to:
2021.explanation: Nisab is the threshold of wealth that makes Zakat mandatory.

2021.question: A Hadith Qudsi is a saying of the Prophet (S.A.W) where:
2021.A: The meaning is from Allah but the words are from the Prophet
2021.B: The words are from Allah but it's not in the Qur'an
2021.C: It relates only to the life of the Prophet
2021.explanation: Hadith Qudsi contains divine messages expressed in the Prophet's words.

2021.question: Shirk is defined as:
2021.explanation: Shirk is the opposite of Tawhid (Oneness of God) and is an unforgivable sin if unrepented.

2021.question: The Prophet’s migration from Makkah to Madinah is called:
2021.explanation: This event marks the start of the Islamic (Hijri) calendar.

2021.question: Which month is the fast of Ramadan observed?
2021.explanation: Ramadan is the ninth month of the lunar calendar.

2021.question: The direction faced during Salat (the Qiblah) is toward:
2021.explanation: Muslims face the Ka'aba for all daily prayers.

2021.question: Tayammum is dry ablution performed when:
2021.explanation: Tayammum uses clean earth or sand as a substitute for water.

2021.question: The first Mu'adhin (caller to prayer) in Islam was:
2021.explanation: Bilal was chosen for his beautiful voice and steadfast faith.

2021.question: A woman's waiting period after divorce or death of her husband is:
2021.explanation: Iddah ensures there is no pregnancy before a woman remarries.

2022.question:
CONTEXT: The Farewell Pilgrimage (Hujjatul Wida). The Prophet (S.A.W) said: 'O People, lend me an attentive ear, for I know not whether after this year, I shall ever be amongst you again.'

1. In which Islamic year did the Farewell Pilgrimage occur?
2022.explanation: The Farewell Hajj took place in the 10th year after Hijrah.

2022.question: [Refer to context in Q1] On which plain did the Prophet (S.A.W) deliver the famous Farewell Sermon?
2022.explanation: The sermon was delivered at Mount Arafat (Jabal al-Rahmah).

2022.question: [Refer to context in Q1] What did the Prophet (S.A.W) emphasize regarding the treatment of women?
2022.B: Treat them with kindness and respect
2022.explanation: He reminded the Ummah that women have rights over men and should be treated well.

2022.question: [Refer to context in Q1] According to the sermon, superiority in the sight of Allah is based only on:
2022.explanation: He stated that an Arab is not superior to a non-Arab except by piety.

2022.question: [Refer to context in Q1] What two things did the Prophet (S.A.W) say he was leaving behind for guidance?
2022.explanation: He guaranteed that if Muslims held fast to these two, they would never go astray.

2022.question: The 'Sahihayn' refers to the Hadith collections of:
2022.explanation: These are the two most authentic collections of Hadith.

2022.question: The ritual of animal sacrifice during Hajj is in memory of:
2022.explanation: It commemorates Ibrahim's willingness to sacrifice his son Isma'il for Allah.

2022.question: The belief in the Oneness of Allah is called:
2022.explanation: Tawhid is the core foundation of Islam.

2022.question: Which Angel is responsible for blowing the trumpet (Sur) on Judgement Day?
2022.explanation: Israfil will blow the trumpet twice to mark the end of the world and the resurrection.

2022.question: The city originally known as 'Yathrib' is now called:
2022.explanation: It was renamed Madinat al-Nabi (City of the Prophet) after the Hijrah.

2023.question:
CONTEXT: The period of the Khulafa'ur-Rashidun (The Rightly Guided Caliphs).

1. Who was the first Caliph to lead the Ummah after the death of the Prophet (S.A.W)?
2023.explanation: Abu Bakr was elected as the leader to maintain the unity of the Muslims after the Prophet's passing.

2023.question: [Refer to context in Q1] Which Caliph was known as 'Al-Faruq' (The one who distinguishes truth from falsehood)?
2023.explanation: Umar b. Khattab was given this title for his justice and strong adherence to truth.

2023.question: [Refer to context in Q1] During the Caliphate of Abu Bakr, the 'Wars of Apostasy' were known as:
2023.explanation: The Ridda wars were fought against tribes that refused to pay Zakat or followed false prophets after the Prophet's death.

2023.question: [Refer to context in Q1] Which Caliph was the son-in-law of the Prophet (S.A.W) and the hero of the Battle of Khaybar?
2023.explanation: Ali b. Abi Talib was married to Fatimah (R.A) and was renowned for his bravery.

2023.question: [Refer to context in Q1] The Khulafa'ur-Rashidun period lasted approximately how many years?
2023.explanation: The combined reigns of the four Caliphs lasted from 632 CE to 661 CE.

2023.question: The Arabic term for the 'Oneness of Allah's Lordship' is:
2023.explanation: Rububiyyah refers specifically to Allah as the Creator, Provider, and Sustainer.

2023.question: How many times is the name of Prophet Muhammad (S.A.W) mentioned in the Qur'an?
2023.explanation: His name appears 4 times (Muhammad) and once as Ahmad.

2023.question: The fast of 'Ashura' is observed on the 10th day of:
2023.explanation: It commemorates the day Allah saved Prophet Musa and the Israelites from Pharaoh.

2023.question: The marriage gift given by the groom to the bride is called:
2023.explanation: Mahr is a compulsory gift that becomes the exclusive property of the bride.

2023.question: Which Surah is known as 'The Heart of the Qur'an'?
2023.explanation: Prophet Muhammad (S.A.W) described Surah Yasin as the heart of the Qur'an in a Hadith.

2023.question: The act of 'Sujud' in Salat refers to:
2023.explanation: It is the position where the forehead, nose, hands, knees, and toes touch the ground.

2023.question: Who was the mother of Prophet Isma'il (A.S)?
2023.explanation: Hajar was the mother of Isma'il, while Sarah was the mother of Ishaq.

2023.question: The 'Sunan' are collections of Hadith that focus primarily on:
2023.explanation: Sunan collections (like Abu Dawood) are organized according to chapters of jurisprudence.

2023.question: The crime of false accusation of adultery in Sharia is called:
2023.explanation: Qadhf carries a specific legal penalty to protect people's honor.

2023.question: Which battle was a turning point where the Muslims were defeated due to lack of discipline?
2023.explanation: The archers left their positions on the hill, leading to a counter-attack by the Quraysh.

2023.question: The Makkan Surahs are generally characterized by:
2023.B: Short verses and focus on Tawhid
2023.explanation: Makkan Surahs focus on faith, the afterlife, and the stories of previous prophets.

2023.question: The term 'Al-Amin' given to Muhammad (S.A.W) means:
2023.explanation: Even before Islam, he was known by this title in Makkah.

2023.question: Which pillar of Islam is performed only once in a lifetime for those who are able?
2023.explanation: Hajj is mandatory only once for those with the financial and physical means.

2023.question: The collection of sayings and actions of the Prophet is known as:
2023.explanation: Hadith refers to the prophetic traditions.

2023.question: In the Qur'an, Allah is referred to by how many Beautiful Names (Asma al-Husna)?
2023.explanation: There are 99 traditionally recognized names of Allah.

2024.question:
CONTEXT: The Science of Hadith (Mustalah al-Hadith).

1. The chain of narrators reaching back to the Prophet (S.A.W) is called:
2024.explanation: Isnad is the pedigree or chain of transmission for a Hadith.

2024.question: [Refer to context in Q1] The actual text or wording of the Hadith is called:
2024.explanation: Matn is the message or statement of the Prophet itself.

2024.question: [Refer to context in Q1] A Hadith that is narrarated by so many people that it is impossible for them to have agreed upon a lie is:
2024.explanation: Mutawatir Hadiths provide absolute certainty in their authenticity.

2024.question: [Refer to context in Q1] A Hadith narrated by only one person at some stage of the chain is:
2024.explanation: Gharib means 'strange' or 'solitary' in terms of narration count.

2024.question: [Refer to context in Q1] Imam al-Bukhari's collection is famous for being the most:
2024.explanation: Sahih al-Bukhari is considered the most authentic book after the Qur'an.

2024.question: The 'People of the Book' (Ahl al-Kitab) refers to:
2024.explanation: This term refers to those who received previous scriptures (Torah and Gospel).

2024.question: Which Surah must be recited in every unit (Raka'ah) of Salat?
2024.explanation: The prayer is not valid without the recitation of the opening chapter.

2024.question: The Prophet (S.A.W) was born in the 'Year of the...':
2024.explanation: He was born in the year Abrahah attempted to attack the Ka'aba with elephants (570 CE).

2024.question: The Islamic ruling that 'Actions are judged by intentions' is the basis of:
2024.explanation: This is a famous Hadith found in the collection of Imam Nawawi.

2024.question: Zakat-ul-Fitr is paid during which month?
2024.explanation: It is paid before the Eid-ul-Fitr prayer at the end of Ramadan to help the poor celebrate.

2024.question: The angel in charge of the gates of Paradise is:
2024.explanation: Ridwan is the guardian of Jannah, while Malik is the guardian of Jahannam (Hell).

2024.question: The term 'Halal' means:
2024.explanation: Halal refers to anything allowed under Islamic law.

2024.question: The prayer performed during the nights of Ramadan is:
2024.explanation: Tarawih is a sunnah prayer performed in congregation after Isha in Ramadan.

2024.question: Who accompanied the Prophet (S.A.W) during the Hijrah to Madinah?
2024.explanation: Abu Bakr was his close companion and stayed with him in the Cave of Thawr.

2024.question: The 'House of Wisdom' (Bayt al-Hikmah) in Baghdad was a center for:
2024.explanation: It was a major intellectual hub during the Islamic Golden Age.

2024.question: A Muslim male is allowed to marry up to how many wives under specific conditions?
2024.explanation: Surah an-Nisa permits up to four wives provided they are treated with equal justice.

2024.question: Which companion was known as the 'Sword of Allah' (Saifullah)?
2024.explanation: Khalid b. Walid received this title for his military genius and undefeated record.

2024.question: The first month of the Islamic calendar is:
2024.explanation: The Hijri year begins with the month of Muharram.

2024.question: The ritual of walking seven times between the hills of Safa and Marwah is:
2024.explanation: Sa'i commemorates Hajar's search for water for her son Isma'il.

2024.question: The Qur'an was revealed over a period of how many years?
2024.explanation: Revelation began when the Prophet was 40 and ended near his death at 63.

2025.question:
CONTEXT: The sources of Sharia (Islamic Law).

1. When the Qur'an and Sunnah do not provide a direct answer, the consensus of scholars is called:
2025.explanation: Ijma is the unanimous agreement of qualified Muslim scholars on a specific issue.

2025.question: [Refer to context in Q1] Deductive reasoning by analogy is known as:
2025.explanation: Qiyas applies the ruling of an existing case to a new case based on shared underlying causes.

2025.question: [Refer to context in Q1] The effort of a scholar to derive a legal opinion from primary sources is:
2025.explanation: Ijtihad is the intellectual exertion used to solve new legal problems.

2025.question: [Refer to context in Q1] An action that is neither rewarded nor punished (neutral) is classified as:
2025.explanation: Mubah refers to permissible actions that carry no spiritual weight on their own.

2025.question: [Refer to context in Q1] A legal verdict or opinion given by a qualified scholar is a:
2025.explanation: A Fatwa is a non-binding legal opinion on a point of Islamic law.

2025.question: The Prophet (S.A.W) belonged to which tribe?
2025.explanation: The Quraysh were the most powerful tribe in Makkah.

2025.question: Who was the first woman to embrace Islam?
2025.explanation: Khadijah, the Prophet's first wife, was the first believer.

2025.question: The prayer for rain is called Salat-ul-:
2025.explanation: Istisqa is performed during times of drought.

2025.question: How many angels are mentioned by name in the Qur'an?
2025.explanation: While millions exist, only a few are named specifically in the text.

2025.question: The migration of the Prophet (S.A.W) to Madinah took place in:
2025.explanation: 622 CE is Year 1 of the Hijri calendar.

2025.question: Which Prophet is known as 'Khalilullah' (The Friend of Allah)?
2025.explanation: Ibrahim (A.S) was given this title for his unwavering devotion.

2025.question: The tax paid by non-Muslims in an Islamic state for protection and exemption from military service is:
2025.explanation: Jizyah was a poll tax in historical Islamic governance.

2025.question: What is the meaning of 'Islam'?
2025.B: Submission to the will of Allah
2025.explanation: Islam is derived from the root 'Salama', meaning peace and submission.

2025.question: The night on which the Qur'an was first revealed is called:
2025.explanation: The Night of Decree/Power occurs during the last ten nights of Ramadan.

2025.question: Who was the father of Prophet Yusuf (A.S)?
2025.explanation: Yusuf was one of the twelve sons of Ya'qub (Jacob).

2025.question: The primary language of the Qur'an is:
2025.explanation: The Qur'an was revealed in the Arabic of the Quraysh dialect.

2025.question: The funeral prayer in Islam is called:
2025.explanation: It is a Fard Kifayah (communal obligation).

2025.question: Which Prophet was given the Zabur (Psalms)?
2025.explanation: Prophet Dawood (David) received the Zabur.

2025.question: The throwing of stones at the pillars (Jamarat) during Hajj symbolizes:
2025.explanation: It commemorates Ibrahim's rejection of Satan's temptations.

2025.question: How many Prophets are mentioned by name in the Qur'an?
2025.explanation: While there were many more, only 25 are named in the Qur'an.
